contextId.information: Bildad is speaking with irony to express that there is not any real joy for the godless person. AT: "this is all the joy they will receive from their godless actions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
contextId.quote: this is the "joy" of such a person's behavior

contextId.information: In these statements, Job is accusing Bildad. The word "one" refers to himself. AT: "I am powerless and have no strength, but you act like you have helped meâ€”but really, you have not helped me at all!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
contextId.quote: How you have helped one ... the arm that has no strength!

contextId.information: Elihu is criticizing Job and his friends. He does not think they are actually wise. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
contextId.quote: you wise men ... you who have knowledge

contextId.information: The wicked consider darkness to be their light, because they do their evil deeds in the darkness and they are familiar with the darkness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])

Yahweh uses mocking irony to emphasize that Job does not understand light and darkness. AT: "It is obvious that you do not know, because you were not born when I created them, and you are not very old." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
